metadata.Title: CVE-2020-21913 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
International Components for Unicode (ICU-20850) v66.1 was discovered to contain a use after free bug in the pkg_createWithAssemblyCode function in the file tools/pkgdata/pkgdata.cpp.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-21913` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libicu52 - 52.1-3ubuntu0.8+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> firefox, thunderbird, mozjs don't build pkgdata.cpp

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
icu package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.1-3ubuntu0.8+esm2').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
